prior_works.title: FunSearch: Program search using a large language model and a verifier
prior_works.role: Closest prior AHD framework with LLM-driven program synthesis and selection
prior_works.relationship_sentence: EoH directly builds on FunSearch’s LLM+evaluator loop, but extends it by co-evolving both natural-language heuristic “thoughts” and executable code with explicit evolutionary operators, improving efficiency and robustness.

prior_works.title: Hyper-heuristics: A survey of the state of the art
prior_works.authors: Edmund K. Burke, Michel Gendreau, Graham Kendall, Gabriela Ochoa, Ender Özcan, Rong Qu
prior_works.role: Foundational framework for Automatic Heuristic Design (AHD)
prior_works.relationship_sentence: EoH instantiates the hyper-heuristic paradigm by defining a search space of heuristics (as natural-language thoughts and code) and navigating it via evolutionary computation, aligning with the survey’s vision of search over heuristics.

prior_works.title: Genetic Programming: On the Programming of Computers by Means of Natural Selection
prior_works.role: Foundational method for evolving executable programs
prior_works.relationship_sentence: EoH is a modern GP-like system where the LLM acts as a powerful mutation/variation operator to generate and repair code from high-level descriptions, with fitness given by heuristic performance.

prior_works.title: ParamILS: An Automatic Algorithm Configuration Framework
prior_works.authors: Frank Hutter, Holger H. Hoos, Kevin Leyton-Brown
prior_works.role: Evaluation-driven algorithm design and selection across instances
prior_works.relationship_sentence: EoH adopts the evaluation-and-selection ethos of algorithm configuration by scoring candidates over instance distributions and exploiting selection pressure to generalize beyond training sets.

prior_works.title: Chain-of-Thought Prompting Elicits Reasoning in Large Language Models
prior_works.role: Methodological inspiration for representing and editing intermediate reasoning in natural language
prior_works.relationship_sentence: EoH’s notion of heuristics as natural-language “thoughts” is grounded in CoT, enabling interpretable intermediate reasoning that can be evolved and then translated into code.

prior_works.title: AlphaDev: Discovering new fast sorting algorithms using deep reinforcement learning
prior_works.role: Program-level algorithm discovery via search and performance feedback
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Like AlphaDev, EoH performs performance-guided search over programs, but replaces RL over assembly with LLM-driven code generation and EC over thought/code representations.

prior_works.title: Neural Combinatorial Optimization with Reinforcement Learning
prior_works.authors: Irwan Bello, Hieu Pham, Quoc V. Le, Mohammad Norouzi, Samy Bengio
prior_works.role: Learning problem-specific heuristics for CO via ML
prior_works.relationship_sentence: EoH targets the same CO benchmarks but departs from parametric policies by automatically discovering human-interpretable heuristics in natural language and code through evolutionary search.

synthesis_narrative: EoH sits at the confluence of three lines of work: hyper-heuristics and automatic algorithm design, program-level search/evolution, and LLM-based reasoning/coding. Foundational AHD ideas from hyper-heuristics (Burke et al., 2013) and configuration (ParamILS) establish the central principle of evaluating candidate heuristics across problem instances and selecting the best—EoH inherits this evaluation-driven loop to promote generalization. From the program-evolution tradition (Koza’s Genetic Programming), EoH borrows the notion of evolving executable artifacts, but replaces brittle syntactic mutations with an LLM capable of translating and repairing code from higher-level descriptions. This directly connects to recent program search systems like FunSearch, which couple an LLM with a verifier; EoH advances that template by explicitly co-evolving two coupled representations—the natural-language “thoughts” that describe heuristic ideas and the code that implements them—using evolutionary operators to explore and recombine both spaces efficiently. Chain-of-Thought prompting provides the representational insight that intermediate, textual reasoning can serve as a manipulable object of search, making the heuristic space interpretable and amenable to guided variation. Finally, algorithm discovery efforts such as AlphaDev and neural combinatorial optimization demonstrate the power of performance-guided search for CO; EoH targets the same domain but achieves greater flexibility by searching over human-readable heuristic ideas and leveraging LLM codegen, yielding competitive or superior heuristics with lower computational budgets.
